item.title: Copying over old content
item.description: import shutil, os, re myfiles = os.listdir('../../python_copy/old/') # myfiles.remove('*~') for filename in myfiles: print(filename) ## 2017-05-03-welcome.md ## 2017-05-04-add-notes.md ## 2017-05-11-add-435-notes.md ## 2017-05-21-add-tilman-notes.md ## 2017-06-07-MacroSquad-schedule.md ## 2017-06-14-MacroSquad-notes.md ## 2017-06-19-kjump.md ## 2017-06-19-olg-question.md ## 2017-06-26-two-corrections.md ## 2017-07-04-607-notes.md ## 2017-07-13-lag-operator.md ## 2017-07-18-classical-monetary-model.md ## 2017-07-21-607-final.md ## 2017-07-22-optimal-search.md ## 2017-07-24-shimer-planner.md ## 2017-07-24-shimer-planner.md~ ## 2017-07-26-balancing-materials.md ## 2017-08-05-a-functional-mapping.md ## 2017-08-14-a-gif.md ## 2017-10-05-ipython.md ## 2018-01-02-welcome-402.md ## 2018-01-22-ex-ante-ex-post.md ## 2018-01-22-ex-ante-ex-post.md~ ## 2018-01-24-units-gdp-deflator.md ## 2018-02-04-establishment-survey.md ## 2018-02-04-establishment-survey.md~ ## 2018-07-18-IIFET-seattle.md ## 2018-09-11-U-M-econ.

item.title: Many models in R
item.description: Introduction This is an example of using R to run many regressions and collect a single regression coefficient from each model. The code uses R’s list-columns feature. Data library(forcats) library(tidyquant) date_start <- "1960-01-01" dat <- tq_get(c("UNRATE", "CPIAUCSL", "CPILFESL"), get = "economic.data", from = date_start) ur <- dat %>% filter(symbol == "UNRATE") %>% rename(ur = price) %>% select(-symbol) dat <- filter(dat, symbol != "UNRATE") Check that the unemployment-rate data are read in correctly:

item.title: Converting the Jekyll website to Hugo and Blogdown
item.description: MathJax.Hub.Config({ TeX: { equationNumbers: { autoNumber: "AMS" } } }); Table of Contents Introduction Footnotes $ \LaTeX{} $ Emojis Alerts and helpful hints Table of contents Introduction Using Jekyll as a static site generator with GitHug Pages on a Windows computer required setting up an Ubuntu environment to issue a jekyll serve command. Doing so became annoying. Another big selling point was the inclusion of R code in posts, a feature that I quickly became accostomed to after writing a couple of course websites in R Markdown and publishing them with GitHub Pages.
